file_content.text: I'm all yours now, Captain.
So... Captain. Funny running into you here. You're making a habit of saving my life....
I mean, uh, thank you for freeing me from this place and that sadistic jerk and....
What do you say we make this a permanent arrangement?
This is just a complicated scheme of Rogun's to drive me to suicide, right?
No! Please! No!
See, and I'm so glad you brought that up.
Grab a bunk and come along. Should be good for some laughs.
Sure, kid.
No no no, just listen. I know Rogun! I could help you with...
Did you say, "yes"?
You remind me of me, kid--uh, without the fins and gills and stuff.
I like you.
Oh, you won't regret this. I'm going to try to be exactly like you!
I want everything you know about Rogun. I need every advantage I can get.
You could be useful.
Absolutely. I mean, we weren't exactly blood brothers, but I've got some idea of how he operates, where he keeps his stashes.
Anything I know, it's yours.
You betray me, and your life's not worth a scream in space, got it?
Don't make me change my mind.
Y--yes, Captain.
Are you trying to give me a reason to shoot?
Don't make me hurt you.
Hey, I know you don't need much encouragement, but hear me out.
I know Rogun. I can help you, tell you what he might be planning, where his stashes are.
It'll be mutually beneficial. I'll be like your apprentice, and you'll be like my... guy I tell things to.
You've got potential. You just got to stop making people want to kill you.
I guess it can't hurt.
But that's my best skill--! I see what you mean.
I'll need a reason that outweighs the fact that you're a two-faced lying scum who tried to get me killed.
Convince me.
See, it's exactly that kind of insightful understanding of the human condition that I need to learn!
I don't travel with traitors.
No way.
We worked so well together! With the guards? I've got contacts, knowledge... I can hold my own with a blaster.
And that's before you teach me! I'm a blank slate, Captain.
Never know when I'll need someone to bait a trap or provide live fire cover....
You might be useful.
Hmm, not usually the first job skills I list....
Still, I know we'll be a great team!
Hey, what do you guys eat on your ship? Because I have a lot of allergies... let's just go.
There's just one thing, first.
Fine, but.... [Punch Guss]
Ow! What was that for? Don't answer that.
Does this mean I can come?
Thank you so much! I can't wait to start learning from you.
Let me just get my things. And adjust the humidity in your ship. My skin is really sensitive to... never mind.
He deserved an uglier death.
Come on! It won't take long for the rest of them to catch on.
The cloaker's inside, just past those guards. They've got the keycode to get in.
But these guys aren't too bright. I mean, they're used to: Shai Tenna barks, they jump.
We should be able to put one over on them, no problem. I'll follow your lead.
Clear out! Property of the White Maw. No one in or out without our say-so.
Didn't anyone warn you guys about Hothian ice fever?
What about the plague?
No! I'm not sick! I'm too young to die! Aaarrrgh!
Oh, no! Everyone back up! If this is the ice plague, every drop of infected spittle contains enough virus to kill a dozen men!
What are you talking about?
They're full of it. You've got ten seconds to scram before I shoot.
All right. Let me count: one... two... I was never good at math.
Ten seconds? [Attack]
I've got the antidote, but it'll cost you.
You need the cure.
You'd better take it. There's only three doses left on Hoth because the Empire's blockading supplies--trying to wipe us out!
Why haven't we heard anything about this?
I'm not risking it. How much for a dose? This is all I've got.
Hand over the credits, open the door, and my associate will give you the cure.
That'll do.
I'll take that, your blasters and whatever's behind this door you're guarding.
Not good enough.
I don't know about--
Thank you. Now step aside and turn around. The shot is administered to the posterior muscle group....
Ice-fever free! We weren't lying.
Now go in. The cloaker is in one of the cells.
Sadly, you were incurable.
Too late. [Shoot him]
I was told to bring the victims here and lock them up with anyone who gets exposed.
This place is quarantined.
Ack. Hrph-hrph. Let us in and then get out of here--or you might never leave!
Maybe we should do it....
Are you kidding? Shai Tenna would kill us. Let me get him on the link--
No! The, uh, ice fever, it travels through communication lines. Comlinks are, uh, very dangerous... ah, forget it.
Shai Tenna's meeting me inside. I found a traitor in his ranks.
I've got important business.
Me? I'm no traitor! I--I told you I can explain!
I told Shai Tenna not to trust the fish.
I'm not defending myself to these morons. I want to talk to Shai Tenna! He'll understand it was all part of the plan!
Shai Tenna's not in there.
Then he won't come running when I do this.
Good. [Shoot him]
What are you--? Attack! All men to the front!
We're going to need to work on our routines....
Am I supposed to cart this filth all over Hoth? I'm gonna end it right here.
Then I don't need this fool.
No! I'm loyal, I swear. I need to see Shai Tenna.
Just open the door, man! Don't let this lunatic kill me!
Why would I care what happens to you?
Well, if that's how you feel....
Good act, there! It, uh, was an act, right?
You know all his secret passages? His trapdoor to the wampa pit, Alilia's real name?
You sure?
H--he didn't say anything about expecting visitors.
That's because you're not supposed to know about this guy. Shai Tenna's got him watching us.
She's Shai Tenna's secret weapon. He's got her watching us all the time.
How do you think I ended up here?
You say you're in good with Shai Tenna? Prove it.
Would you believe me if I said he's my brother?
We go way back.
No.
Next time, be more gullible.
What the--? Attack! All hands to the front!
If I wasn't working for Shai Tenna, would I know that his favorite drink is Mandallian Narcolethe?
I know so much about him.
Shai Tenna only drinks Urrqal!
Alcohol kills.
My line of work doesn't have written contracts. Now are you going to let me in, or do I call Shai Tenna and tell him you're the one who made me late?
Now you want documents?
Make him late! Make him late!
Alilia's in there. Maybe Shai Tenna's really got some kind of back entrance.
Then let him sort this out. If he's gonna set up meets and not tell us, we can't be held accountable.
Go in. But... keep my name out of it.
Let us in unless you two want to share a grave.
Open the door. [Shoot guard]
Attack! Attack! All men to the front!
Maybe there's something I should have explained about con jobs--duck!
Let me make this up to you. I can get you to the cloaker, no tricks, no traps.
Where is the cloaker? And what hoops do I have to jump through to get it?
Fine. Show me.
First thing goes wrong, you're dead.
You'd better not be lying.
Wow, that's, uh--perfectly fair. I see your point.
The White Maw's base is in one of the Republic's downed ships. Lots of guards, no visitors.
I'll meet you there. We can work together to get past the guards and find the cloaker.
Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, you're a dead man.
Forget it.
See, that's what I love about you. You're decisive.
You're smart, you're beautiful, nobody messes with you. The kind of girl, you never know will you pick the lock or blast your way through?
You're smart, you're tough, you say two words and you've got girls falling at your feet.
All I want is to learn from the best crook in the business.
Do you truly think you can grow a spine, little fish?
You run in the seediest holes in the galaxy and still know what's right. Let me learn from you.
Who knew you had so many good points?
Aw, Captain, I think he likes you.
"Right" is highly overrated.
He seems sincere.
What you're looking for is a base in one of the Republic's downed ships. I'll meet you there. Let me prove myself by getting you the cloaker.
Though you might be surprised when you meet him....
That's twice now. The... saving my life.
And I meant it before, about not lying, so... just give me a second. This is new ground for me.
I work for Rogun. There, I said it. The whole reason he sent me to Hoth was to kill you and... I don't want to do it anymore.
You work for the man who's chased me across six different planets, and you "don't want to do it anymore"?
You work for Rogun?
The whole story. And I'll know if you're messing with me.
Tell me the truth.
I had no idea what you were really like.
I'm going to kill you.
I'd rather be killed by you for the truth, than by Shai Tenna to cover a lie! Though... I'd rather not be killed at all.
The Jedi Order, it's all black and white. Like, why try if I've already turned my back on the light?
I ended up in hock to Rogun. He basically made me Shai Tenna's slave, told him to use me how he wanted.
You did know they don't call him "Rogun the Cuddly Defender of Orphaned Jedi," right?
What did you expect?
Hey, I thought "The Butcher" meant the guy couldn't be beat--until I met you.
Are you making an offer, or expecting me to write your biography?
What's your point?
Not hearing any reason to put you on my live-and-let-live list.
I'm still going to kill you.
You've won my respect, now let me win yours. I know Rogun's plans--some at least--and I know about you.
You sweet-talked Alilia, saved me, turned Kandhar's men against him. Rogun doesn't inspire half the loyalty you do.
You killed Kandhar, the Voidwolf's men. You're going to make short work of Shai Tenna, and I think Rogun's next.
Watch out!
Y--you saved my life. Shai Tenna was going to kill me. I-- First things first...
There are Gand bounty hunters waiting in the next room, courtesy of Rogun the Butcher.
Apparently, it was personal.
How many? How good?
Tell me about them.
Why were Shai Tenna's men trying to kill you?
I've got questions, first.
Oh, all the usual reasons. Doesn't matter.
Where does Rogun keep finding these people?
Rogun never gives up.
The bounty hunters rigged this whole place with that poisonous sludge they breathe. As soon as the door opens, that stuff is going to pour in here.
If you don't want to drop dead before a shot hits you, forget the Gand. Go past them into the room and target the gas valves.
You're just a font of helpful information, aren't you?
How do you know so much?
This showing up and knowing exactly what I need is getting annoying.
Who are you really?
Rogun's got to be sick of getting his toys broken.
They'll be sorry.
Look out!
You came just in time!
Sorry, Guss. You've served your purpose. Now Shai Tenna wants us to tie up some loose ends....
No. This isn't the way it--
Captain! Please, for the love of all that is good and righteous, help me!
Exactly what purpose did you serve, Guss?
What are they talking about?
I know it looks bad. Just let me explain.
If Shai Tenna wants you to fight someone, fight me.
Hands off!
Thanks. We don't usually get an invitation.
You got yourself into this, you can get yourself out.
This is your problem.
Why do you always think this is my fault?
Kill her, boys.
Kill him, boys.
Oh, my heart almost stopped when I heard what happened.
I had no idea. I mean, I knew the guy was sleazy... kind of bloodthirsty, and not all that hygienic....
But it turns out Shai Tenna's here under orders of some big-shot gangster, Rogun the Butcher. He's trying to bring the whole White Maw into Rogun's fold!
Rogun's got a crush on me. He keeps sending me presents.
I know Rogun.
You think this was personal?
If Kandhar and Rogun both work for the Voidwolf, why'd Shai Tenna want him axed?
What about the Voidwolf?
The Voidwolf? I never heard him linked with Rogun--
Look, all I know is the minute Shai Tenna dumped you, his men went on a killing spree.
I was going to kill Shai Tenna already. Now I'm going to make it hurt.
Then I owe them both.
Do it quick. Shai Tenna's on a rampage.
He's taken out half the leaders of the White Maw, and he's not slowing down.
Whatever you're after, you'd better get it. And fast.
The Republic wants whatever the White Maw is using to get around their sensors.
I want their cloaker.
Oh, I'll bet. That kind of secret brings a fat payday, no?
I'm not telling you anything.
Really? Most people find me harmless and kind of charming. Never mind.
I want Shai Tenna's head. It's Rogun's birthday this year, and I don't have a gift.
I'm looking for revenge.
Major Panin's notes said you're after the White Maw's cloaker, right?
I bet the Republic would pay good money to get it for themselves.
I can help. When Shai Tenna started heads rolling, they moved the cloaker to an underground base for security.
I don't suppose it's somewhere convenient like between Shai Tenna's ribs?
Help me.
Ha. I like your sense of humor. And I bet not everyone says that.
What's in this for you?
Why are you here?
Call it an overdeveloped sense of personal guilt. Plus, I'd really love to watch someone feed Shai Tenna his own teeth.
The base is nearby, through some rough territory.
I'll find it myself.
I don't trust you.
Really? How many wampa-filled ice caves are you willing to search through?
Come on. Let me make this up to you.
I'll run ahead, distract the guards. There's a back way in with only automated security. You should be able to handle it.
Think of this as my way to say "I'm sorry."
Please! Let me live. I--I know things about the White Maw. I can help you.
Quit whining. You're giving fake Jedi a bad name.
I'm not going to kill you.
You're the real deal, you know? Most people would let this little kind of misunderstanding really get under their skin--I'll stop.
What have you got? If it's good enough, you might live.
Tell me what you know.
Use those sensors to get in--that part wasn't a lie. I can set up a meet.
Maybe I'll just kill you and find a way in myself.
I don't trust you.
No! The White Maw won't deal with outsiders. Take the sensors to Shai Tenna, buy his favor--that part wasn't a lie, I promise.
I'll set up a meet. Just give me a chance.
Why does this not feel like the smartest thing I've ever done?
I'm going to regret this...
No, it's brilliant! What small-minded Republic soldier would make such a shrewd call to turn a potential enemy into an asset?
Get me into the White Maw and we'll call it even.
Fine. Where do I go?
Set me up and you're dead.
You are so much more reasonable than it says in your file! I mean...
I'll go tell Shai Tenna you're coming. And, ah, send you the coordinates. You won't regret this!
You lied to me!
Yes, and I would love to discuss that, but I was just on my way out.
See, there's a, uh, disturbance in the Force and uh....
Oh no.
I'm sure you have an airtight explanation for sending me to attack friendly forces, right?
I'm a reasonable person.
Your first lie was more convincing.
You're not helping.
It's... it's not what you think.
Are you really a Jedi? I don't usually kill Jedi, but I could make an exception.
Talk fast or I shoot.
I--I am a Jedi. Or was, you know, a Padawan, but... I can see the Force, I just can't use it.
They threw me out when I got caught with a cheat sheet for the Jedi Code. I--I didn't have any skills, anywhere to go.
Not exactly a hot job market on Hoth.
So you came here?
You could say I "drifted into crime." Small stuff, you know, con games.
Skip to the part where you wanted me to attack the Republic.
Talk about me.
I'm losing patience.
I ended up working for the White Maw, and they dragged me here.
They gave me to Shai Tenna. A Weequay, one of their rising stars. He sent me for the sensors.
Tricked me into doing your dirty work, huh?
And then you sent me?
It's nothing personal.
I admire your nerve, but you're an idiot.
You've got gall.
This is starting to look really not good for you.
You're not helping your case.
I don't want to serve them! Really. I--I've tried to escape, but no one cares that I used to be a Jedi.
The White Maw would as soon kill me as keep feeding me. If I don't bring those sensors, I'm wampa bait.
Go get the sensors. I'll make sure the lieutenant knows you're coming.
I'm looking for Major Panin.
What are you saying? I wasn't--I mean....
You startled me. I am Master Languss Tuno, Jedi advisor to the Republic forces.
I, ah, assume you're from offworld, seeking the poor late Major Panin?
The "late" Major Panin?
What happened?
Yep, blown to jelly. I, ah, hope you weren't close.
The major's supposed to help me with a covert mission. You ever heard of the White Maw?
I'm with Senator Dodonna.
Yes, he mentioned that. Let me see what his files say about you....
No offense meant, Master Jedi, but I don't discuss my missions with just anyone.
I'm not telling you anything.
A wise move, miss. The Force, um, advises us to keep our secrets close to our hearts.
A wise move, my son. The, ah, Force tells us not to release our secrets easily.
It does?
Absolutely. You ever met a Jedi who answered a question straight? We're all about secrets.
Poor Major Panin died in an Imperial strike on the base a few days ago, killed instantly.
Ah, here are his notes. Senator Dodonna's "privateer," right? Infiltrating the White Maw? It won't be easy to earn their trust.
They wouldn't be sending me if the White Maw had out the welcome mat.
That much I knew.
True; these are some organized and nasty sons of Hutts--I mean....
The Force have any insights you could pass along, Master Jedi?
Tell me about them.
So long as they're afraid, I think they'll welcome me just fine.
I don't need them to trust me.
You can't just take them on! These are some organized and truly nasty sons of Hutts--I mean....
My child, the Force is dark around these pirates. They have great anger. Serious, serious anger, do you understand?
You have to get at them from inside. That means showing no loyalty to the Republic... and having something they want.
You spend a lot of time thinking about how to infiltrate pirates, Master Jedi?
I see you have a plan.
Hey, I'm a Jedi. We've got nothing to do but think.
There'll be a way. I just need to make it to the table.
Everyone's got a price.
Look at me, "Master." Which of us do you think knows more about pirates?
I don't take advice from Jedi.
These pirates are our greatest threat, after the Imperials. I've learned more than I wish.
Last week, White Maw pirates tried to grab a cache of ship-to-ship sensors.
If you can "steal" those--with the Republic's full permission, of course--they'd make the perfect goodwill offering.
The Republic's permission, huh? You going to make sure of that?
Will you arrange it?
Steal? Permission? You want to take a breath and explain?
What are you talking about?
The Republic wants to buy these guys off, why not just give me the sensors?
Why go through all that?
So you fly into the base on a Republic shuttle, talk with the major and then come offering gifts?
No. We've got to stage this, make it look like a real heist.
The droids guarding the cache will have to defend it to be convincing, but I'll inform the lieutenant in charge.
Just tell me where. I wouldn't want to accidentally take something you really need....
All right. Where to?
I bet you were that kid at the Jedi Academy who short-sheeted the Masters' beds.
You're enjoying this.
Twenty hours of meditation on a cold rock every blasted time.
It's all on you, then, if something goes wrong.
You're taking charge?
Absolutely. The Jedi Council teaches that, ah, we are all responsible for the lives we touch.
I've got the coordinates here. The cache is inside a cave not too far away.
Like I said, the White Maw tried it already, so there's security at a few different checkpoints. But I'll warn the Republic.
They won't interfere at all.
I wouldn't let you on my ship if you were dead and in parts.
Get out of here.
Well, ick, neither would I. That would stink up the whole....
All right. All right. No harm asking. I thought.
But don't blame me if you get caught and killed by Rogun because I wasn't there to warn you.
Don't worry about me. You didn't hurt my feelings. Nothing I can't get over.
I can always kill you later.
